term.title: fluorogenic

item.text: Property of a material in which fluorescence is induced or enhanced by the addition of another molecular entity.

notes.item: An example is a non-fluorescent compound consisting of a pyrene connected to a maleimide group (which quenches the pyrene fluorescence). A reaction in which the maleimide moiety is converted to a succinimide derivative results in the recovery of the pyrene fluorescence.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 341 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
